semantic_title: Tobacco Use During Pregnancy, Childbirth and Puerperium
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > l. Alcohol, tobacco and drug use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium > 2) Tobacco use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium

content.full_text: Codes under subcategory O99.33, Smoking (tobacco) complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be assigned for any pregnancy case when a patient uses any type of tobacco product during the pregnancy or postpartum. A secondary code from category F17, Nicotine dependence, should also be assigned to identify the type of nicotine dependence. (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding tobacco use in pregnancy requiring dual coding with obstetric and nicotine dependence codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)
key_concepts: O99.33 for any tobacco use in pregnancy/postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L58-L59)
F17 secondary code required for nicotine dependence type (Evidence: pg no: 68, L59)
Applies to any type of tobacco product (Evidence: pg no: 68, L58-L59)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign O99.33 and secondary F17 code for tobacco use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any tobacco product use during pregnancy or postpartum requires both obstetric complication code and nicotine dependence code (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)
common_applications: Other tobacco product use in pregnancy

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify tobacco use during pregnancy or postpartum
Step 3: Add secondary F17 code for nicotine dependence type

code_ranges.description: Smoking (tobacco) complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 68, L58)
code_ranges.requirement: Primary code for tobacco use in pregnancy
usage_rules: Use for any type of tobacco product use (Evidence: pg no: 68, L58-L59)
Identifies type of nicotine dependence (Evidence: pg no: 68, L59)

code_categories_mentioned: Subcategory O99.33 - Smoking (tobacco) complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 25-year-old female at 30 weeks gestation, continues to smoke 1 pack per day
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify tobacco use complicating pregnancy
Step 3: Add F17.210 for cigarette nicotine dependence

correct_coding.sequencing: Obstetric complication first, then nicotine dependence
correct_coding.rationale: Dual coding required for complete documentation of tobacco use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only nicotine dependence code without pregnancy complication code

warnings: Must code any type of tobacco product use during pregnancy or postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L58-L59)
best_practices: Always use dual coding for tobacco use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L57-L59)
common_mistakes: Using only F17 codes without O99.33
tips: Applies to any tobacco product, not just cigarettes
implementation_notes: Applies to pregnancy and postpartum periods
clinical_context: Tobacco use is significant complication in pregnancy
